doc.field: Series XXIII: Pride and Progress / The Right Stuff
Series XXIII: Pride and Progress / The Right Stuff
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 55 [2]--The Right Stuff, Episode No. 166[Air Date: 10/13/1985] [3]--Gay Video 12/2 9:30 and Show Show No. 2 and Tape 2-Not Complete
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 55 [2]--The Right Stuff, Episode No. 166[Air Date: 10/13/1985] [3]--Gay Video 12/2 9:30 and Show Show No. 2 and Tape 2-Not Complete

Pride and ProgressNews-highlights:1. Rock Hudson death and AIDS federal funding2. Diane McGrath wants to close all gay sex establishments and start mandatory HTLVIII tests for health and food employees3. Jerry Falwell loses court battle, must pay 5,000 dollars to gay activist Jerry Sloan4. Two prominent West German public officials come out of the closetCOMMERCIAL: Orientation '85, funded by The National Gay Task Force5. The future of New York's gay rights bill6. Barry Gingell, New York City physician, discusses smuggling illegal AIDS drugs from Mexico7. AIDS treatment around the world8. Princess Diana fires "confirmed bachelors" due to sexual orientationCOMMERCIAL: "New York Native" with Quentin Crisp9. Sports, includes clip10. Healthline: Conversations with GMHC: Ken Wein, psychotherapist, discusses how to cope with AIDS anxiety11. Closing credits
The Right Stuff:1. Sybil BruncheonCOMMERCIAL: GMHC Healthy Sex Workshops2. Sybil Bruncheon reads lettersCOMMERCIAL: Orientation '85, funded by The National Gay Task Force3. Sybil Bruncheon closesCOMMERCIAL: AIDS hotline, New York AIDS Action4. Broadway Confidential, includes clip from "Golden Girls"5. Current events/media/culture, includes clip from "Hotel"
